TopicTitle: What will you do when .21 hits?

Articles.Content:
As the lumbering shoggoth that is .21 is getting very close to hitting, what are your plans?

Mine are to muck about with new parts, send an exploration mission, around the new KSC, then send the (stock hab block of my new station, hen put one round the mun, along with the first parts of my mun base, then wait for kethane and ep to be updated so I can hopefully set up a base in a procedural crater in an old crater. The base shall be called Yo Dawg ( I have to go and brush my teeth after that one)
Im going to THE MUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUNNNNNNNNNNNNNNN!!!
I shall test out the new ASAS with my SSTO spaceplane one trouble I had with it was keeping it on the 90 facing flat
I'm gonna go recruit some Kerbals.

Spam the Mun with buggies, way stations, and bases. Recreate my space station. Make my planned trip to Eeloo (already prototyped the vehicle and lander).

Then other stuff.
Starting fresh.

Well first I'll fire up the Patcher (and wait for something to happen)... Then I'll mess around with the new features, and third I'll see about upgrading my .20 save.

Edited July 9, 2013 by RocketPilot573
I shall make a reeeeeaaaally unstable ''thing'' and see how the new SAS handles that.
Patch the game?

Sit on the Support board and hope I can handle any new issues...

I have no idea what new bugs or pebkac errors I'll face.

I'm (very) new to the game so I'll start my Space Program. Not restart. Not recreate. Start. From scratch.

I'm just a little excited.

Only after I plot the downfall of Soviet Krussia, have a revolution, make up a new national anthem, redesign the flag, and go back to the original anthem because everyone hated the new one will I get back to playing the actual game.

So, after all of that. I will mourn the loss of my infiniglider, then I'll do orbital stuff (more math: actually caring about TWR, ÃŽâ€v, etc.) and then I'll recreate my first MÃƒÂ¼n landing. I'm going to skip the first station because station, and get right on with establishing a refueling station. I hope to get to other planets before 0.22!
Try to design an asymetrical station that looks cool and use the new asas

Probably catch a few hours of sleep after the experimentals phase, then manning the Support forum for a fair bit while we get the usual flood of topics from people who complain their saves don't work or that mods are incompatible. Or simply reporting 'bugs' that are caused by (outdated) mods without mentioning they use mods.

I love you guys! sometimes..
I'll just make short flights to the Mun and wait for 0.21.1 before doing anything more elaborate.
You realize that the new ASAS system can't magically balance asymmetric things, right? It's just less wobbly than the old one.
Mostly everything is on hold in my current game. Once .21 hits, I'll be once again trying again to go interplanetary.

I will pop a bottle of champagne when .21 comes out!

The first thing I will do in .21 will be [REDACTED]!!!!!

Figure out how to edit the persistence file to move my (planted) flags to .21. Followed shortly by figuring out which of my flags on the Mun are now buried in ejecta or floating above a new crater and correct accordingly.
There will be flames, explosions, and things falling from the sky in a more or less controlled fashion. Just like every other day.

Lots of docking, without loosing all of my RCS fuel to ASAS wobble!

Take a deep look at the new designs of buildings and stuff.... and recruit some kerbals depend on how much of that career thing is implemented...

And of course write some bugreports with my outdated plugins i don't mention in my reports

Currently I'm going balls to the wall, warping like there's no tommorow, spamming mods as there won't be a chance when the update hits and anyhow, I have this enormous interplanetary vessel assembled in orbit and I want to use it.
Make a rocket powered rover and go stunt driving in the new craters.
If the new crew system is what i imagine it to be, I will be training kerbonauts till .22!
I'm going to frantically do testing to see if 0.21 broke the mod I wrote. Before my mod-users start yelling at me.
